026package com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.operators;
027
028import java.math.RoundingMode;
029
030import com.ibm.streams.operator.AbstractOperator;
031import com.ibm.streams.operator.OperatorContext;
032import com.ibm.streams.operator.OutputTuple;
033import com.ibm.streams.operator.StreamingInput;
034import com.ibm.streams.operator.StreamingOutput;
035import com.ibm.streams.operator.Tuple;
036import com.ibm.streams.operator.model.InputPortSet;
037import com.ibm.streams.operator.model.OutputPortSet;
038import com.ibm.streams.operator.model.OutputPortSet.WindowPunctuationOutputMode;
039import com.ibm.streams.operator.model.Parameter;
040import com.ibm.streams.operator.model.PrimitiveOperator;
041
042/**
043 * Set a decimal attribute's scale. Each input tuple results in
044 * an output tuple that includes all matching attributes and
045 * the modified decimal attribute. Example of a functor style
046 * operator that directly extends {@link AbstractOperator}.
047 * <P>
048 * The operator supports two parameters:
049 * <UL>
050 * <LI> <code>name</code> Name of the attribute to be modified.</LI>
051 * <LI> <code>scale</code> Scale for modified attribute.</LI>
052 * </UL>
053 * <BR>
054 * The output tuple's value for attribute <code>name</code> is a result
055 * of:
056 * <OL>
057 * <LI> Obtaining a <code>BigDecimal</code> from the input tuple attribute with the same name.</LI>
058 * <LI> Setting the scale of the value with <code>RoundingMode.DOWN</code>.</LI>
059 * <LI> Assigning the modified value to the output tuple's attribute
060 * which may truncate the value according to its defined type:
061 * {@link com.ibm.streams.operator.Type.MetaType#DECIMAL32 DECIMAL32},
062 * {@link com.ibm.streams.operator.Type.MetaType#DECIMAL64 DECIMAL64} or
063 * {@link com.ibm.streams.operator.Type.MetaType#DECIMAL128 DECIMAL128}.
064 * </LI>
065 * </OL>
066 * </P>
067 */
068@PrimitiveOperator(comment=DecimalScaleSetter.IBM_Teracloud_ApS_COPYRIGHT)
069@InputPortSet(cardinality=1)
070@OutputPortSet(cardinality=1,windowPunctuationOutputMode=WindowPunctuationOutputMode.Preserving)
071public class DecimalScaleSetter extends AbstractOperator {
072    
073    /**
074     * Name of the attribute to set the scale on.
075     */
076    private String name;
077    
078    /**
079     * Scale to set the output attribute to.
080     */
081    private int scale;
082    
083    /**
084     * Initialize the operator.
085     */
086    @Override
087    public void initialize(OperatorContext context) throws Exception {
088        super.initialize(context);
089    }
090    
091    /**
092     * Set the name for the decimal attribute.
093     * @param name Name of output attribute
094     */
095    @Parameter(description="Name of input attribute to have its decimal scale set.")
096    public void setName(String name) {
097        this.name = name;
098    }
099    /**
100     * Set the scale for the decimal value.
101     * @param scale Scale for the output value
102     */
103    @Parameter(description="Scale to set for input attributes with name `name`.")
104    public void setScale(int scale) {
105        this.scale = scale;
106    }
107    
108    /**
109     * Get the scale value to set the attribute's value to.
110     * @return The scale value to set the attribute's value to.
111     */
112    private synchronized int getScale() {
113        return scale;
114    }
115    
116    /**
117     * Get the name of the attribute being modified.
118     * @return The attribute name being modified.
119     */
120    private synchronized String getAttributeName() {
121        return name;
122    }
123
124    /**
125     * Submit each input tuple, modifying the named attribute by setting its scale.
126     * Matching attributes are copied from the input tuple to the output tuple
127     * using {@link OutputTuple#assign(Tuple)}.
128     */
129    @Override
130    public void process(StreamingInput<Tuple> port, Tuple tuple) throws Exception {
131        
132        final String attributeName = getAttributeName();
133        StreamingOutput<OutputTuple> out = getOutput(0);
134        OutputTuple outTuple = out.newTuple();
135        outTuple.assign(tuple);
136        outTuple.setBigDecimal(attributeName,
137                tuple.getBigDecimal(attributeName).setScale(getScale(), RoundingMode.DOWN));
138        out.submit(outTuple);
139    }
140}
